macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: U.S. Stock Markets Close Higher on Monday, December 23, 2025
items.summary: All three major indexes advanced: Dow Jones up 0.5% to 48,362.68, Nasdaq up 0.5% to 23,428.83 driven by AI stocks, and S&P 500 up 0.6% to 6,878.49 with technology sector gaining 2.2%. Trading volume was lower at 14.57 billion shares, and VIX fell 5.6% to 14.08.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Rejected at $90K as Market Faces Technical Resistance
items.summary: Bitcoin traded between $87,052 and $90,588 over the past 24 hours, currently at $87,434 down 2.40%. A trendline from record highs is limiting BTC's recovery attempts.

items.title: Global Crypto Market Cap Declines to $2.96T
items.summary: The cryptocurrency market cap dropped 2.1% over the last 24 hours, with most major cryptocurrencies trading mixed amid holiday season volatility.

items.title: Michael Selig Appointed as New CFTC Chair
items.summary: Michael Selig has been appointed as the new Commodity Futures Trading Commission Chair amid a U.S. financial innovation era.

items.title: Arizona Senator Proposes Tax Exemption for Bitcoin and Cryptocurrencies
items.summary: An Arizona Senator has proposed legislation to provide tax exemptions for Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies.

items.title: Japan Plans to Digitize Local Government Bonds by 2026
items.summary: Japan is moving forward with plans to digitize local government bonds, advancing blockchain adoption in government finance.

items.title: Bitcoin Spot ETFs Experience Significant Net Outflows
items.summary: Bitcoin spot exchange-traded funds are seeing notable net outflows as investors adjust positions.

items.title: Bitcoin Heads Toward Worst Quarter Since 2018
items.summary: Bitcoin is on track for its worst quarter since 2018, putting pressure on altcoin markets.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI Tracks Nearly 100 Years of Aging Research, Revealing Key Trends and Gaps
items.summary: A new study published on December 23, 2025, uses natural language processing and machine learning to map aging research trends, showing a shift from basic cellular studies to clinical topics like Alzheimer’s, while identifying gaps in emerging areas such as autophagy and epigenetics.

items.title: Artificially Intelligent Control System for Fusion Energy Devices Wins 2025 Kaul Foundation Award
items.summary: PPPL researchers received the 2025 Kaul Foundation award on December 23, 2025, for developing an AI control system that tames the edge of plasma in fusion energy devices using 3D magnetic fields.

items.title: Major Tech Company Reports Major Breakthrough in Artificial Intelligence Development
items.summary: A prominent technology company announced on December 23, 2025, a significant advancement in artificial intelligence, marking a key development in the field.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Alphabet Acquires Intersect for $4.75B to Power AI Data Centers
items.summary: Alphabet agreed to acquire renewable energy company Intersect for $4.75 billion to meet soaring electricity demands from AI training and inference workloads, with a Texas site expected to launch in 2026.

items.title: Nvidia Restructures Cloud Team, Steps Back from AWS Competition
items.summary: Nvidia reorganized its cloud division after retreating from direct competition with hyperscalers, refocusing on its core silicon and software tooling advantages.

items.title: G42 Pulls Out of Cerebras Partnership
items.summary: Abu Dhabi-backed G42 is withdrawing from its planned partnership with AI chipmaker Cerebras, citing deployment challenges and software compatibility issues with non-Nvidia alternatives.

items.title: SoftBank Racing to Complete $22.5B OpenAI Investment by Year-End
items.summary: SoftBank is accelerating efforts to finalize its $22.5 billion funding commitment to OpenAI before 2025 closes, exploring multiple financing options including asset sales.

items.title: NIST Invests $20M in AI Centers with MITRE Corporation
items.summary: NIST expanded collaboration with MITRE Corporation, allocating $20 million to establish two centers focused on manufacturing solutions and critical infrastructure cybersecurity.

items.title: Lovable Raises $330M Series B at $6.6B Valuation
items.summary: Swedish AI startup Lovable secured $330 million in Series B funding led by Google CapitalG, reaching a $6.6 billion valuation.

items.title: ZeroAvia Secures $150M Series D for Zero-Emission Flight
items.summary: ZeroAvia raised $150 million in Series D funding to advance zero-emission commercial aviation technology.

items.title: Apple Releases iOS 18.4, macOS 15.4 Betas
items.summary: Apple made beta versions of iOS 18.4, macOS 15.4, and other operating system updates available to developers.
